alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin and western Hart Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Carnesville, or near Canon, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carnesville, Royston, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Tugaloo State Park, Victoria Bryant State Park and Martin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
